body:
### Problem

`nvim --clean repro.lua`, `:source`, type `q`
```lua
local buf1 = vim.api.nvim_create_buf(false, true)
local buf2 = vim.api.nvim_create_buf(false, true)
vim.cmd [[au BufLeave * sil! up!]]
vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd(
  'BufUnload',
  { once = true, callback = function() vim.api.nvim_buf_delete(buf1, { force = true }) end }
)
vim.keymap.set('n', 'q', '<cmd>quit!<cr>')
vim.cmd(([[
tabnew
b %s
diffthis
vsplit
b %s
diffthis
]]):format(buf1, buf2))
```



### Steps to reproduce

.

### Expected behavior

No sigsegv.

### Nvim version (nvim -v)

0.11.0

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

not sure

### Operating system/version

linux

### Terminal name/version

xterm

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-kitty

### Installation

built from source

comment_data.body:
More general script that also reproduces in Vim:
```vim
set nohidden
autocmd BufLeave * call tabpagebuflist()
tabnew
let b = bufnr()
vnew
autocmd BufUnload <buffer> ++once exe b .. 'bwipe!'
quit
```
and the crash also happens if `BufLeave` is changed to `WinLeave` or `TabLeave`.
Hmm, this seems similar to the problem fixed in vim/vim#14166.

labels.description: issue reporting a crash or segfault
labels.name: bug-crash

title: sigsegv on `nvim_buf_delete` in `BufUnload`
